headline: How We Lost Faith in Everything
abstract: Our institutions lost the capacity to mold character and have become platforms for performance instead.
lead_paragraph: Americans are living through a social crisis. We can see that in everything from vicious partisan polarization to rampant culture-war resentments to the isolation, alienation and despair that have sent suicide rates climbing and driven an epidemic of opioid abuse. These dysfunctions appear to have common roots, but one symptom of the crisis is that we canâ€™t quite seem to get a handle on just where those roots lie.
